text: Building a large site with it as well...also i am really exited to use the theme editor

in a dnd page, I am getting this error, but there are a million modules on the page and I cannot track down what it is.
> *Error*
> One of your modules has incorrect information. Please make sure you’ve completed any required fields.
Is there a way to point to which module is preventing the page from publishing?

Hi John, when/where are you receiving the error?

Is it on the publish button?

I
1. click publish to staging in upper right hand corner
2. click publish to staging in the modal
3. an error box with that message then appears
and none of the modules are highlighted in red
if not, this would be a great suggestion for the ideas channel
Yeah I can see how that can be frustrating, I'll relay this to the team.
Thanks for bringing to our attention
so this is happening on 20+ content staging pages. And the client is wants to launch monday
Should I make a support ticket?
This is now on our radar, so no support ticket needed.
While this isn't the best solution, I can offer you a temporary workaround.

If you go to the network tab and look at the failed request after clicking publish, you should see the `response.errors` field containing an array which you can use to see what modules contain the errors.

that did the trick.
For what is is worth, it was a field hidden by a display condition. The repeatable field had a minimum of 1 and there was no default count. Maybe turn off a field’s validation if it is hidden by a condition

Glad to hear it worked. Interesting problem, I don't know if turning off the validation if it's hidden would be the right move though.

While I can't think of the best example right now, I can see scenarios where it would be a purely logical based value as opposed to anything visual.

Regardless, we'll make sure to integrate the module errors into our UI, so it's clear to users in the future.
